38779339.review:
What an exciting game! Not only does Sky Knights make you feel like a Top Gun pilot, but it looks really cool while doing it.
This is a no-brainer, and you should definitely be adding this to your collection.

The controls are basic and easy to get into, and covers what you'd expect for an arcade flight simulator.  Throttle up & down, Turn left & right, Fire primary & secondary weapons... and then of course there's the afterburner and the "maneuvers" mechanic. 
Push the manevuer button and you'll pull back on the stick to shoot  into the air where you can then position yourself for a kill (or escape!). As your own experience grows you'll be able to perform amazing dogfights - where air tactics actually play out as you'd expect... AND you can see it all due to the beautiful contrails. Just watch out for the sides of those cliffs though!

There's a good selection of US & Soviet fighters to choose from, and each with a particular role ranging from ground attack to air supremecy.  Matches are 4v4 skirmishes where you need to destroy 3 of the enemy's bases before they get yours, and it generally lasts about 20 minutes a match.

As you level up you unlock special abilities which then become available in matches, to be purchase with currency you get by destroying enemy units.  This is a very well thought out progression system for both your own level as well as the skirmish map.

Audio and video quality is of equally high standards than the rest of the game design and mechanics. It's not trying to be super realistic with visuals, but it's own unique style works extremely well.
The game is still in Early Access, so there's only 2 available maps. I'm sure we'll be getting more maps and expanded features down the line. [b]Even for an Early Access game it delivers a wonderful, fun and solid experience[/b].

All in all I'm strugling to find anything negative about this game. It is super fun, well designed, and I get to feel like a fighter pilot! I'm extremely exciting to see where this will be going, and based on the Discord channel the developer is very interactive.

So... Get it, it's good :)

36254794.review:
Sky Knights is definitely worth the $10 and investment in time. The game has a lot of spirit to it and the maneuver/stamina system hits the sweet spot of easy to learn, but hard to master. While only controlled with a single button, the maneuver system adds a whole new dimension to the dogfighting and interacts well with other flight mechanics. A confrontation between two planes doesn't just come down to turning speeds and a well-played A-10 can get the advantage over a Su-27. The tutorials in-game, guides, and matches against bots allow for newer players to get the hang of flying their plane, while the actual matches can get intense and competitive. I've witnessed many games come down to a single bombing run on a base. Your contribution to your team's success is also very noticeable and the result of the match doesn't feel arbitrary or random. If you're looking for a nice multiplayer game with both strategy and skill involved or are into fighter jets, Sky Knights is a wonderful game to pick up.

Now, as with any indie multiplayer game, the life of the community is very critical to its success. The Sky Knights community is small as of right now, but is growing. Bots will have to fill up the empty slots on most matches, but chances are very high that you'll play against at least some players. Joining the Discord server can also help a lot with finding matches and playing during peak times on the right servers will definitely be rewarding.

One common criticism of Sky Knights is the lack of content. This is unfortunately true to some degree. There is a limited selection of planes, maps, and gamemodes. However, the content that is present is good. Each of the planes fills its own unique role and the balance between them is good. There are only two maps so far, one offering a greater emphasis on skill and the other on strategy, but both hold up to gameplay. Woodlands runs slightly slower than the other map, but still offers good gameplay. A recent patch made the map run a lot smoother and will hit a manageable FPS on slower computers. The game definitely needs more content in order to grow, but the developer updates it regularly and is very involved with the community. This game definitely has a future as long as the community stays as active as it is.

Also, there's no microtransactions. You just pay the $10 for the game. Given the current state of many multiplayer games right now, this is a much needed and relaxing break from pay-to-win, endless DLCs, and costly cosmetics.

인디게임 입니다. 탑뷰 형식의 에이스컴뱃이라고 생각 하시면 될 것 같습니다.
하지만 에이스컴뱃처럼 엄청난 싱글을 생각 하셨다면 오산입니다 이게임은 멀티 전용 게임 이거든요.

서론은 이쯤에 해두고 

조작:조작은 진짜 초등학생들이 할 수 있을정도의 조작성을 보여줍니다 엄청 쉽습니다.

게임:탑뷰 형식의 4대4 MOBA입니다. 적의 기지를 전부 누가 먼저 파괴하는냐 입니다
미니언 같은 장갑차와 포탑같은 대공전차가 있습니다. MOBA 게임 처럼 라인 밀기도 가능하구요
게임은 대략 길어봐야 15~20분? 체감상 10분 정도 걸립니다
비행기 클래스는 총 3가지로 나누어 집니다.

1.올라운드 만능형:전폭기 처럼 지상 공격도 할 수 있고 전투기 처럼 공중 공격도 할수 있습니다.
하지만 CAS와 대공특화형 보다는 미사일 갯수가 적습니다.
2.CAS (보통 전폭기라 부르죠):미사일이 전부 지상공격용으로만 이루어져 대공능력은 없다고 보시면 됩니다 CAS는 정말 타워나 라인밀때 씁니다
3.대공특화형:미사일이 전부 공중공격용으로만 이루어 져있고 올라운드 만능형이 들고 있는 미사일보다 사거리가 훨씬 길고  더 좋습니다

진영이 2가지가 있지만 성능은 전부 같고 외형만 다릅니다.

그리고 미니언을 죽이거나 상대 플레이어를 죽여서 버는 달러로 기체를 업그레이드 할 수가 있습니다.
예를 들어 기관총 탄약을 더 증가 시킨다거나 플레어 성능을 좀 더 올린다거나 미사일 갯수를 늘린다거나 장갑을 더 단단하게 만든 다거나 등등 이런것들도 레벨업을 하면 할 수록 더 많이 추가되니 레벨을 올리는 맛도 있습니다.
기체 노즈아트도 구현되어 박스를 까서 얻는 식 입니다.나름대로 커스텀 마이징이 있습니다.

고증:이런류의 게임은 항상 고증같은 이야기가 나오기 마련이죠 하지만 미리 얘기 해두고 싶습니다
각 기체마다의 섬세한 고증은 바라지 않는게 좋습니다. 밸런스를 위해 기체고증은 죽여서 전부 똑같습니다
클래스마다는 다르지만요.하지만 다른 부가적인 기능들의 고증은 잘 살렸다고 봅니다. 미사일 시야에는 벗어 났지만 파일럿 시야에 있으면 락온 할 수 있는 파일럿 헬멧 HUD 같은 기능들 말이죠.

그래픽: 그래픽은 카툰 렌더링을 쓴것 같은 만화 같은 그래픽입니다.그래서 그렇게 화려 하지 않으면서도 나쁘지 않은 느낌입니다.
각 기체의 모델링은 잘 되어 있다고 봅니다

가격:10500원 네 담배 두갑이죠. Early Access라고 본다면 적당한 가격입니다. 게임 볼륨도 딱 멀티전용 게임이라 그정도가 맞는거 같습니다. 그리고 무엇보다도 Early Access를 위시한 창렬게임 특히 데이즈 보다도 개발자들이 게임에 애착을 가지고 열심히 개발한다는걸 느낄 수 있습니다 업데이트도 자주 하는 편입니다.

이런 류의 게임 특성상 한글이 지원 안되서 이게 도대체 뭔가 하는 것들이 많아 일반인 들에게는 솔직히 추천 하고 싶지는 않습니다만, 혹시 당신이 에이스컴뱃의 열렬한 팬이거나 전투기들을 좋아 한다거나 하시면 분명 좋은 게임이라고 말씀 드리고 싶습니다.



이상 제 주관적인 평가였습니다.

36097702.review:
This game is great! It's such a little gem to me. And it has potential... great potential. There are a couple caveats, but read on.

It's very approachable, but has enough depth to allow player skill to actually influence a match. You can get in a plane and use strategy - lay in wait, make the right runs and decisions, and perform with little actual skill, just patience and strategy. Or you can master your aerodynamics, make turns other players can only dream about, and smoke half the enemy team's superiority fighters while flying a multirole. And the best part is, their strategy can still give your skill a run for its money. Keep in mind that all the while, this is a 2 1/2 dimension top-down arcade game, too.
I can't speak to the PC controls, although I'd be concerned about precision in them, but I absolutely loved the XBox controls, having played a bunch of Ace Combat before.
Personally, I find the matches a bit short, but they can pack in quite a bit of action. The choices you make and upgrades you buy are crucial, and require an eye that understands the flow of battle. If you're excellent at air superiority, a good option is to swat down attackers and base rushers, limiting your losses and strafing ground targets in your spare time. If you're more of a ground pounder, you can jump in an attacker and shred the ground forces, doing significant damage to enemy bases and paving the way for your ground armies to conquer. And you can surprise a cocky fighter or two and gun them down, too. Or you can be a jack of all trades: with skill in both areas, you can almost instantly change modes and tactics. Buzz around the middle and create your own no-fly zone, realize the match is at a breaking point and bomb a base in seconds.
The disparity between players lies mostly in skill and choice, and I love that. There's not really a tier system, as planes are generally equally useful with equal pilots. There is a progression, as you unlock additional perks and upgrades until you reach level 20. That's not a huge grind, and you can do it without facing a single player, as the PvE rooms grant mostly the same rewards as players, with the exception of Ranks for finding a place on the leaderboard and Wings for buying decals (and hopefully soon, camos and skins).
With the recent addition of the MiG-21, it shows there will be achievement-based ways to unlock new aircraft and that excites me. It paves the way for craft like the A-4 Skyhawk, the A-8 Crusader, the F-14 Tomcat and the MiG-31 Foxhound. Indeed this game has great potential, if it can survive......

The two things it lacks is, first, content: because it's a one man job in his spare time, the maps probably take a while to make, and the game was only recently feature complete, it's barely in beta. That will come with time, and hopefully, community involvement. I strongly recommend the addition of campaigns, semi-historical scenarios, and multiplayer co-op. The dev plays a lot of Wargame: Red Dragon so I trust him ;)
The second thing is a playerbase. While some of us are quite active and dedicated, there are very few of us. This alone is the number one reason why this second issue is not fixed: with so few players, more players are very reluctant to commit by purchasing this game, and it stays in this state. Bankler is doing what he can with this sale and with ingame events, but that alone may not enable this game to take off (punny). So if you're willing to be active, join our Discord and coordinate matches so we can all play together, you can be part of the solution and if you look and try I assure you you'll hardly experience this second problem.

Overall, I love Sky Knights. It's an easy yet competitive game, great as a casual time-burner for me. I can't help but recommend it despite its minor, fixable flaws. Just remember - you, along with us, can be part of the solution!

34492443.review:
[h1] Review - Sky Knights [/h1]

[h1] RATING: 6.0 / 10 [/h1]
A decent early access moba that needs many improvements if wants to be in the right direction.

===

[h1] Overview [/h1]
Sky Knights is a pvp-oriented 4v4 MOBA featuring war planes facing each other, defending their bases and attacking enemy ones, supported also by ground units and fixed artillery positions. The gameplay is rather simplistic if compared to other titles of this kind, as for now there is a kinda restricted number of upgrades and skills with which you can enhanche your vehicle during the match, and also generally just 3 classes of planes are sort of small choice, anyway the gameplay concerning PVP is good.

===

[h1] Gameplay Analysis [/h1]


[b] General Gameplay [/b]
Sky Knights plays out as any moba can be: there are two teams composed by 4 players, each has 3 FOBs, Forward Operating Bases, which they have to protect. FOBs are also defended by fixed anti-air cannons, which act as Towers and can be destroyed by players and ground units (Creeps) alike. The first team to take out all 3 enemy FOBs will win the game.

There are 3 classes of planes currently available: Air Superiority, designed to bring down other aircrafts and equipped with the best PvP gear, it is made specifically to destroy enemy fighters and ground strike planes. Then we have the Fighter-Bomber, which is a middle class which can both be decent at dogfighting and ground attack, but is not great at any of those, a bit of a jack of all trades, has both bombs and missiles for planes. Last but not least there is the Ground Strike plane, designed to destroy ground targets such as Towers, vehicles, and FOBs, it comes equipped with anti-tank missiles which can 1-shot any ground unit, an autocannon to inflict pain to ground targets and bombs to inflict more damage to FOBs than any other weapon.

All planes share a common pool of upgrades you can buy with gold, which is earned by defeating enemy players, bots, ground vehicles, towers and FOBs. Some upgrades only apply to certain planes, for example extra bombs will only have an effect on planes that carry bombs, and so on.

The geam currently features leaderboards, a rank system, achievements, and passively unlocked upgrades, skins and other stuff you get by leveling up with XP, which is obviously earned by playing!



[b] Combat System [/b]
Combat in Sky Knights is fast-paced and i'd say equally skill and loadout based, as it is in all MOBAs after all. In combat each plane has a cone in front of it which defines the area its main gun can target, each plane has its own machinegun with its own damage and rate of fire, and also its own loadout. When engaging another plane, two things will make the difference, first is using the Afterburner, which consumes extra fuel but gives a great speed boost for a short time, useful to get closer, or farther, from enemies.

The second important thing are Manouvers, performed with Spacebar by default, if you do a manouver your plane will start doing a full 360 degrees turnaround, which can be oriented with direction and even stopped in the middle to perform some crazy stunts and catch an enemy unaware, of course you can shoot during this ability. These stunts cost Stamina though, and if you run out of it a great vision and maneuverability penalty will be inflicted, so also Stamina Management is important while fighting. What gear you got on your vehicle makes a big difference in combat, as i will better explain later in this review.

Always keep an eye out for how much ammo you have left for each weapon, if you run out, go back to your airstrip, land successfully without crashing and get repaired and rearmed in no time.

Countermeasures are also availablle and are used to deflect heat-seeking missiles, but are impotent against radar-guided ones or machinegun fire. For now the amount of weapons availbale is pretty small but we do hope to see improvements in the future.


[b] Content [/b]
For now content-wise, this game is pretty limited, expected to be as it is an early access alpha, the current content is somewhat solid but the presence of only one map, only 3 plane classes and not so many weapons and upgrades is underwhelming. General structure of upgrade system, progression system, leaderboards and achievemts is there, and overall there is barely enough content even for an alpha game, further updates will hopefully get this aspect better.


[b] Balancing [/b]
Balancing of weapons as far as statistics such as damage, range, quantity, etc. is good, except for SAHR missiles which are drastically overpowered as they cannot be dodged unless you have an upgrade... which can be unlocked only after some levels. And this is the amin problem of balance in this game: in MOBAs each player is supposed to start with different heroes but with the same potential, not being tied in any way to things such as levels.

In Sky Knights the situation is different, as many upgrades you can get during a match will have to be first unlocked with levels, so by playing many other matches before, and so players of many levels superior can face new low-level players and have a major advantage on them because of all those upgrades they unlocked with experience that the new, or low level players won't have. This is a major game design issue which could suit an MMORPG mayber but is totally out of place in a PvP MOBA-like game like this one. In the future i really hope this is resolved because it is one of tha major issues encountered with this game.


[b] Challenge [/b]
The game system is simple to learn, it will take some time to fully understand how manouvers work and get used to stamina and fuel management mechanics, but overall the challenge will be derived from player skill and not from the complexity of the game system which is rather easy to learn at the moment.

===

[h1] Technical Analysis [/h1]


[b] Graphics [/b]
Graphically, you can deduct just with a glimpse that Sky Knights is not exactly top-notch modern graphics, which is not always a bad thing, considering this is a low-budget indie early access game there is large space for improvement in teh future, and looks is not all in a game, but certainly does it part. Said this, graphics are rather simplistic, artistic pictures such as character portraits, plane portraits, backgrounds and UI are good, actual 3D models and game environment are on par with sufficent standards but barely, with the standards of 2017, this is barely sufficent even considering its low budget. Hopefully we will see resources invested in getting also this aspect better in the future, as for now all aspects from models, to efects, to particles, are just sufficent and barebones.


[b] Sound [/b]
Sound effects are nothing spectacular, could have used with some more soundtracks and some chatter when enemies get destroyed, bases get hit, vehciles get smashed and so on... weapons and combat sounds are decent, could have used some better quality especially on gun sounds.


[b] Performance [/b]
Very low-impact game, could run on any current machine, and probably old ones too unless prehistoric or very low spec.


[b] AI [/b]
AI of bots is very primitive and completely cannot stand against human players, this combined with low playerbase results in the team having more players almost always winning because they can just feed upon AIs and get all the upgrades in the blink of an eye.

[b] Quality of Life [/b]
UI is decent, upgrade menu during matches could be improved with categories relative to which upgrade belongs to which plane, right now all upgrades are slammed in a window which becomes kind of a cluster later on when more and more upgrades get unlocked. Apart from this bad thing, nothing else is to be said about quality of life now.

[b] Bugs / Issues [/b]
Nothing in particular to report.

34099220.review:
Игра в своей задумке предельно незамысловата, что, однако, не делает её менее интересной. В игре есть 2 фракции: [b] НАТО [/b] и [strike] СССР[/strike] [b] ПАКТ [/b]. 

Если проводить аналогии с другими ММО, то представленные самолёты можно условно разделить на [u] 3 класса[/u]: [b] Tank [/b] - [i] штурмовики  [/i] (A-10, Су-25), [b] Carry [/b] - [i] тяжёлые истребители [/i] (F-15, Су-27) и [b] Support [/b] - [i] многоцелевые истребители [/i] (F-16, МиГ-29). 

[list]
[*]А-10 и Су-25 обладают самым большим запасом здоровья и мощным вооружением, но при этом по самолётам они могут работать лишь из пушки. 

[*]F-15 и Су-27 обладают средним запасом HP и ракетами повышенной дальности, но у них нет бомбового вооружения для работы по земле, в борьбе с зенитками можно положиться лишь на пушку. 

[*]F-16 и МиГ-29 оправдывают своё название многоцелевых истребителей и несут как бомбы, так и ракеты для ближнего воздушного боя, однако отличаются самым малым запасом прочности.
[/list]

Сами бои проходят весьма динамично, однако могут и затягиваться. Команда, уничтожившая все 3 базы врага, выигрывает. Победы над противником в воздухе повышают мораль ваших наземных войск, что положительно сказывается на их эффективности, поэтому вам не удастся просто завалить бомбами вражеские базы и быстро победить. В свою очередь, симуляция усталости пилота не позволит вам вечно исполнять фигуры высшего пилотажа. В игре присутствует система перков и бустов, а также кастомизация самолётов. Декор падает из ящиков, которые покупаются за здешнюю валюту, зарабатываемую в PvP-сражениях.

В целом игра весьма затягивает, особенно любителей самолётной тематики, однако ей ещё есть, куда расти. На месте разработчиков я бы внёс разнообразие в самолётный парк. Можно как минимум добавить на роль бомбардировщиков A-7, F-4 для НАТО и МиГ-27, Су-24 для ПАКТа. Возможно, стоило бы подтянуть оптимизацию, которая непозволительно хромает для такой простенькой графики. Возможно, игре на пользу пошло бы разнообразие карт, ибо пустынный пейзаж со временем надоедает. К минусам можно отнести отсутствие русского языка, однако интерфейс в игре интуитивно понятен и даже слабых познаний в английском хватит для полного понимания доступных перков. 

Все минусы, которые [u] лично я для себя[/u] заметил, можно свести к тому, что игра ещё совсем новая и сырая, но на то он и ранний доступ. 

[h1] Моя оценка - 8 из 10 [/h1]

《天空骑士》这是一个平面空战的MOBA对战游戏，最多支持4V4的对战模式
地图双方各有3个军事基地，双方的军事基地均会派出地面攻击车辆攻击对方的基地，而胜利条件就是抢先摧毁对方的3个基地。
目前游戏中有苏系3架美系3架，共6架飞机供选，而每系的三架飞机又细分为：
重型陆攻机：机动性最差、航炮载弹量最大、副武器为空对地导弹及航空炸弹，主要任务是攻击敌方地面车辆、基地周围的防空炮，以及对敌方基地。
重型战斗机：机动性中庸、航炮载弹量中庸、副武器为短距空对空导弹及航空炸弹、其定位比较灵活，可以参与狗斗，而因为副武器装备有航空炸弹，也可以作为地方地面目标的攻击手。
轻型战斗机：机动性最高、航炮载弹量中庸、副武器为短距空对空导弹及远程空对空导弹，其主要任务是对空攻击，消灭敌方的飞机。
每种飞机都有一定的载弹量及油料量，消耗完弹药及快消耗完油料时需要回己方机场着陆完成补给
每局中，击毁敌方各种单位都会获得资源点数，资源点数可以在本局中于己方机场购买改造，改造可提高飞机血量，提高各类弹药载弹量等
每局中，在机场随时可以选择同系列的另外两架飞机上场战斗
在战局以外随着玩家等级的提升，会解锁一些被动技能，可以同时携带2个被动技能

E是释放热诱弹

按住空格会做翻筋斗的战术动作，一直按住可以做一个完整的筋斗，根据按住空格的时间长短以及配合AD调整方向，可以做出各种战术动作

33846351.review:
Sky Knights is what happens if you take top-down arcade flight and turn it into a MOBA. Two teams have three foward operating bases each. Each team will also have a plethora of tanks and AAAs (basically "adds") to help them out. Teams can be comprised of 2-4 players or AI each. Your team's objective is to destroy all three of the enemy team's bases. Combining the arcade flight genre with MOBA is a very interesting take, something that I believe has not been attempted before. Kudos to Hampus Bankler for trying something unique!

Flying the planes is as simplistic as possible -- it's arcade, not simulator, so you'll only have to press one button to begin your takeoff. The camera is top-down; don't let the promotional screenshots on the store page fool you, there's no third-person chase camera available. There's also only one altitude that you can fly at, except when you're landing and taking off. As I said, simplistic. But it doesn't take a lot away from the gameplay, it just allows you to focus on the important stuff: flying to your objective, destroying everything in your path, and evading enemy missiles.

The major gripe I have with this game is that little is explained. The tutorial mission, while very well-done, only introduced you to the flight mechanics as well as how to use heatseekers and standard bombs. There's a couple of weapon types that were omitted, flares were skipped over, and the entire premise of upgrading your aircraft mid-battle was not explained at all. There's also a loot crate system (???), and some sort of passive abilities that you earn by leveling up. There's a whole lot that needs to be explained, whether in a second tutorial or in an easier-to-access game menu (there is a second text-only tutorial section hidden in the main menu's tutorial option).

I'm also fearful that this game may not live for very long. I enjoyed it, as I'm sure many others would (hence my recommendation), but indie multiplayer-based games tend to drop off very rapidly these days. I hadn't even heard of Sky Knights until Ace Combat Fan published a video on it and provided me with his second key to help promote the game's multiplayer (thank you to both him and Hampus for providing the key!). The game needs a lot more promotion to bring many more players in to help populate the servers and get things rolling.

Beyond the game's need to explain a few things and maintaining its population, I'm impressed by Sky Knights. It definitely deserves a buy. Particularly at its $10 price point, you can't go wrong. Hoping to see lots of updates in the future, and see you all in the skies :D

Before I start this review, I wish to add note that I received this game for free from the developer through a giveaway. The developer's kindness has no affect on my opinion on the game, but I felt it should be noted.

This game is pretty amazing. When I first watched it, I thought it was a cool concept, but was skeptical about how it would actually play. The gameplay is actually quite fun and fluid. Each plane I have used so far feels different. 

Matches are easy to start, due to empty player slots being replaced with AI. I have noticed that the AI seems to be quite overpowered at some points, but other than that, it's fine.

For being an early access title, the game is not very buggy. I've only run into 1-2 bugs so far, and neither of them were game breaking. The game is also very smooth. I don't believe I ever dipped below 60fps. But at the same time, the graphics aren't amazing, but they're decent. Before full launch, I hope to see the graphics improve greatly.

That's essentially it. If you're looking for a good, fun game to sit down and play with your friends, I suggest this game. It's very fun, and to some extent, requires good teamwork to ensure you complete the objective with the variety of planes and the upgrades they offer.

EDIT: Just played a game where the one of the AI pretty much killed you right off of spawn, while the rest did nothing. It was a 17-4 Drakunov.

Есть такой бородатый анекдот. 

Вьетнамского летчика наставляют перед боем: «Когда станет плохо, щелкни этим тумблером – это форсаж. Если не поможет, нажми тут – это отстрел ложных целей. Если все совсем плохо, тогда нажми эту большую красную кнопку.»

Не повезло вьетнамцу, попал в оборот. Фантом догоняет. Вьетнамец форсаж включил – не выходит убежать, ложные цели все расстрелял, а фантомы не отстают. Тогда нажал таки большую красную кнопку.

Тут же из-за сиденья вылез здоровенный мужик и говорит по-русски: «А подвинься-ка малой.» Ну и конечно сбивает всех фантомов одной левой.

Это я к чему. В этой игре есть все: и форсаж и ложные цели и даже кнопочка вызова аса. Главное штурвал у него отобрать вовремя, иначе так и будет петли вертеть.

Яростно рекомендую!

40331463.review:
Sky Knights is an utterly magnificent, online, action, isometric, arena jet combat game. If you enjoyed the Ace Combat games on Playstation over the past two decades and want to relive the glory of that type of action-packed, aerial combat game then Sky Knights is for you. 

This game has a great online community of both competitive and casual players. The community is very friendly and supportive. Sky Knights is easy to get started with, but difficult to master, thus it is a deep, skill-based, multiplayer, aerial combat game. 

The visual style is distinctive and succeeds in every way due to the clever use of minimal graphic design, models, textures, and landscapes. The soundtrack is quite good for such a small developer's first game. The developer is always communicating with the community via Steam and the official Sky Knights Discord channel, and he listens to community requests and bug reports. 

There are also very few bugs, if a new bug appears with a patch, the developer works hard to eliminate it quickly and so far there have never been any serious bugs. For an early access title, Sky Knights features incredible polish, and the game is very well-optimized for a wide array of PC specifications. 

This game will run great on low-end PC's while still looking beautiful. Ony a high-end PC it will run buttery smooth and it even supports 4K UHD and Ultra-Wide aspect ratios. 

The core gameplay mechanics are extremely solid, and highly addictive. After playing this game in multiplayer for over 60 hours now, I don't see myself getting bored with this amazing game any time soon, especially with the constant and regular updates and new content additions! 

I can't recommend this game enough, so do yourself a huge favor and pick this title up, it's a true masterpiece!

10/10, see you in the skies! :D

-Yopo

40213290.review:
Thrilling, easy-to-learn, challenging-to-master, top-down view, modern aerial and air-to-ground combat game focused on 4 vs 4 PvP battles with options for bots to fill slots. Thrilling and rewarding to play, with a leveling system that unlocks passive modifiers, and also a pool of traits that you can pick a couple to use depending on your play style.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1306418944
[H1]Aircraft[/H1]
The game's balance is based on the NATO and Russian forces each picking from three aircraft of three types: Multirole, Close Air Support and Air Superiority.

For NATO forces, that means F-16 (Multirole), A-10A (Close Air Support) and F-15A (Air Superiority). For Russian forces, you choose from Mig-29 (Multirole), Su-25 (Close Air Support) and Su-27 (Air Superiority).
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1099825801
While the main objective is fairly simple -- destroy 3 enemy bases before the enemy destroys your 3 bases -- the ever changing mix of player and bot plane choices, and the impacts your decisions have on the ground forces battle below you helps make the game anything but predictible. :)

The game's rich weapons tactics become more evident the more you play it, and the more you sifft through the game's own built-in Fighter School tactics page, which gives a lot of valuable insights into evasion and best use of weapons.

[H1]Controls[/H1]
While the game offers partial controller support, keyboard and mouse default controls generally work fine, and you can change key bindings.

Default is steering with A and D keys, with W and S serving as your throttle. Shift kicks in your afterburner for planes that have them; the ground attack specialist aircraft like the A-10 lack an afterburner.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1306412041
Despite the top-down view perspective, the game does provide a sense of changing altitudes, and you can use the Maneuver key (default is spacebar) to pull off loops and Immelmann turns, which isn't quite something I've mastered yet. 

[H1]Multiplayer[/H1]
The game offers multiplayer game lobbies based on region (U.S., Europe, Asia, Australia and Japan). There's a global chat lobby, and simple text chat within the game itself.

If you get the game, don't let relatively low numbers of games on the various regional servers scare you off. Most of the time, if you start an open game, other players will eventually join you. You can fill any slot with an AI bot player, and they'll auto-fill in if a player leaves. The bots are really quite effective, even devious at times. :)

Also, the game seems pretty forgiving in terms of lag, so don't be afraid to check the various servers available. I'm U.S. East Coast, and the game has run fine when I've joined sessions in the other regions.

NOTE: The game is NOT a cockpit-view flight simulator, so if you need a game for your HOTAS throttle system, this is the wrong genre. Saw a lot of confusion on that when this first released in early access. :)
